intro: Lasianthus lucidus var. inconspicuus, commonly known as the glossy lasianthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically glossy and dark green in color. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including parts of India and Southeast Asia. This variety is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
